question: When Diane turns 30, she will be half the age of Alex and twice as old as Allison. Diane is 16 years old now. What is the sum of the ages of Alex and Allison now?
solution:
When Dianne turns 30, Alex will be 30 x 2 = <<30*2=60>>60 years old.
Allison will be 30/2 = <<30/2=15>>15 years old then.
Dianne will turn 30 in 30 - 16 = <<30-16=14>>14 years.
Currently, the age of Alex is 60 - 14 = <<60-14=46>>46.
Currently, Allison is 15 - 14 = <<15-14=1>>1 year old.
So, the sum of Alex and Allison's ages now is 46 + 1 = <<46+1=47>>47 years old.
#### 47
clean_solution:
When Dianne turns 30, Alex will be 30 x 2 = 60 years old.
Allison will be 30/2 = 15 years old then.
Dianne will turn 30 in 30 - 16 = 14 years.
Currently, the age of Alex is 60 - 14 = 46.
perturbed_solution:
When Dianne turns 30, Alex will be 30 x 2 = 60 years old.
Allison will be 30/2 = 15 years old then.
Dianne will turn 30 in 30 - 16 = 14 years.
Currently, the age of Alex is 60 - 14 = 84.
completed_solution_clean:
Allison will be 15 - 14 = 1 year old now.  
So the sum of Alex and Allison’s ages now is 46 + 1 = 47.  

#### 47
completed_solution_perturbed:
Allison is 15 years old when Diane turns 30, which is in 14 years. So Allison is currently 15 − 14 = 1 year old.  
The sum of Alex and Allison’s current ages is 84 + 1 = 85.

#### 85
